description: This foundation-level studio course introduces the aesthetic, conceptual, and technical foundations
of three-dimensional art-making and the ways three-dimensional media inform the creation and
understanding of art in cultural contexts.  Students explore three-dimensional form and space
through a wide variety of materials and media.  The course emphasizes strategies for
idea generation.  Students engage in dynamic activity, spirited investigation, and thoughtful
creative expression.  Materials fee.  Offered each semester. Counts toward biomedical studies
